shaping_description: Pecking/chipping blank into axe shape, 15 cm, depends on shape and material of the blank
time_description: chipping: Up to 40 PH (diabase (4-6 Mohs), grinding: c. 6 PH
reference: Wulf Hein (comments on own Youtube video 2018-19), Informant (MK)

shaping_description: blank: heavy hammer + cutting, and anvil percussion
time_description: Most effective with larger stones (including flint) in the beginning and effectiveness decreasing with smaller hammerstones necessary to avoid breaking the blank, combination of stone and wooden (birch) anvils used.

extraction_description: sawing  (splitting) 30 cm long 10 cm thick block with quartz sand, water and wood in two pieces
cutting blank (max 30 min) and chipping into preform (few minutes)
sawing (splitting) a block into two axes at once (total 100 hours, 50 hours per piece, 2-3 persons)

time_description: grinding could be up to several hundred hours

extraction_description: blank made from nodule of soft amphibolite boulder from the till near Lund,
shaping_description: Axe ID: Axe 11, pecking/chipping blank into unpolished axe
time_description: blank pecked to unpolished axe form, 111 mins, grinding 87 mins
